DataElement.preferredDefinition: An indication the exposure occurrence was environmental or occupational.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: CDISC Domain Environmental Risk Factor Environmental and Occupational Exposure Occurrence Indicator
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A collection of data variables or metadata for use with a Clinical Data Interchange Standards Consortium (CDISC) data submission. Representative examples include Laboratory (LB), Subject Characteristics (SC), and Trial Summary (TS)._Health hazards at home, in the work place, or in nature (e.g., infectious agents, irritants, respiratory fibrotic agents, asphyxiants, allergens, metabolic poisons, physical agents, mutagens, teratogens, and carcinogens). (Winett et al: Health Psychology and Public Health)_An indication as to whether something has happened, such as an event or incident._The exposure to potentially harmful agents in the environment or to work-related environmental factors.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A collection of data variables or metadata for use with a Clinical Data Interchange Standards Consortium (CDISC) data submission. Representative examples include Laboratory (LB), Subject Characteristics (SC), and Trial Summary (TS).

Concepts.definition: A collection of data variables or metadata for use with a Clinical Data Interchange Standards Consortium (CDISC) data submission. Representative examples include Laboratory (LB), Subject Characteristics (SC), and Trial Summary (TS).

Property.preferredName: Environmental Risk Factor Environmental and Occupational Exposure Occurrence Indicator
Property.preferredDefinition: Health hazards at home, in the work place, or in nature (e.g., infectious agents, irritants, respiratory fibrotic agents, asphyxiants, allergens, metabolic poisons, physical agents, mutagens, teratogens, and carcinogens). (Winett et al: Health Psychology and Public Health):The exposure to potentially harmful agents in the environment or to work-related environmental factors.:An indication as to whether something has happened, such as an event or incident.

Concepts.definition: Health hazards at home, in the work place, or in nature (e.g., infectious agents, irritants, respiratory fibrotic agents, asphyxiants, allergens, metabolic poisons, physical agents, mutagens, teratogens, and carcinogens). (Winett et al: Health Psychology and Public Health)
The exposure to potentially harmful agents in the environment or to work-related environmental factors.
An indication as to whether something has happened, such as an event or intervention.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: A category of organic or inorganic substances, elements, and isotopes used in research or for the prevention, diagnosis, and/or treatment of disease states. Includes biologically active substances that are either synthetically manufactured or endogenous substances extracted and processed to be reintroduced into an organism. Chemicals and drugs also include hazardous substances, and naturally occurring or synthetically produced substances required to maintain life.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 3-25-20 tmt released. 3-19-20 tmt created for Seed Study.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Terminology codelist used with Yes No Unknown or Not Applicable Response within the Clinical Data Interchange Standards Consortium Study Data Tabulation Model._An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.
